meanings.sent1: The rabbit was zipping across the field.
meanings.sent2: I saw a car zipping down the highway.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was zipping around the tree, trying to find its acorn.
meanings.sent4: Time was zipping by as we enjoyed our day at the park.
meanings.sent5: The wind was zipping through the trees, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: Fasten or close with a zipper.
meanings.sent1: She was zipping up her jacket to stay warm.
meanings.sent2: He quickly zipped his bag before leaving.
meanings.sent3: The magician zipped up his cape before the show.
meanings.sent4: The astronaut zipped up the spacesuit before the mission.
meanings.sent5: The child was zipping up the tent for the camping trip.

meanings.definition: Compress files for storage or transmission.
meanings.sent1: I am zipping the folder to send it via email.
meanings.sent2: She zipped the photos to save space on her computer.
meanings.sent3: The student was zipping the documents to upload them to the cloud.
meanings.sent4: He zipped the files to make them easier to transfer.
meanings.sent5: The software zipped the files automatically for faster sharing.
